thread.title: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Italy, in response to the Parliament: "Since October 7, we have decided not to send any more weapons to Israel" | Israel today - The Limited Times
thread.title_full: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Italy, in response to the Parliament: "Since October 7, we have decided not to send any more weapons to Israel" | Israel today - The Limited Times

author: Anonym
title: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Italy, in response to the Parliament: "Since October 7, we have decided not to send any more weapons to Israel" | Israel today - The Limited Times
text:
Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs, Antonio Taiani, revealed today (Saturday), the position of the Italian government towards the war between Israel and Hamas.
Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Taiani in his meeting with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, photo: Kobi Gideon/L.A.M.
In response to the leader of the left (of Jewish origin), Eli Shlain, who demanded that Italy not send weapons to the conflicts in the Middle East, Taiani replied that already with the outbreak of the war, the Italian government made a decision not to arm Israel.
The leader of the Italian opposition, Elena (Eli) Schlein, photo: Reuters
"Since October 7, we have decided not to send any more weapons to Israel, so there is no need to discuss this point," Taiani said.
According to him, "the decision was made, we said so in the parliament."
As mentioned, the day before, on Friday, Ellie Shlain said that Italy "must deal with the issue of avoiding fueling these conflicts, of avoiding sending weapons and exporting weapons to conflicts, to conflicts in the Middle East, in this case especially to Israel."
were we wrong
We will fix it!
If you found an error in the article, we would appreciate it if you shared it with us
